sen.j: 楠木正季（くすのき まさすえ）は、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Masasue KUSUNOKI was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 悪党として知られる河内国の豪族・楠木正成の弟。
sen.e: He was a younger brother of Masashige KUSUNOKI who was a local ruling family in Kawachi Province and is known as an Akuto.
He was a younger brother of Masashige KUSUNOKI, who headed a local ruling family in Kawachi Province and was known as Akuto (a villain in the medieval times).
sen.cmt: Akutoの説明を追加、その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: He was a younger brother of Masashige KUSUNOKI, who headed a local ruling family in Kawachi Province and was known as Akuto (a villain in the medieval times).

sen.j: 1336年（建武7年/延元元年）に兄の正成は九州から京都目指す足利尊氏の軍に対して新田義貞の指揮下で戦う事を命じられ、湊川の戦い（兵庫県神戸市）において戦って敗北する。
sen.e: In 1336, his elder brother, Masashige was ordered to fight against the army of Takauji ASHIKAGA who was heading from Kyushu to Kyoto under the command of Yoshisada NITTA, but was defeated in the Battle of Minato-gawa River (Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 古典「太平記」などには兄・正成と刺し違えて自害したと記され、このとき有名な「七生報国」（七たび生まれ変わっても、朝敵を滅ぼし、国に報いるの意）を誓っているが、一部ではこれが正成の発した言葉と誤解されている。
sen.e: In a classical literature, 'Taiheiki', and others, he is described to have committed suicide with his elder brother Masashige by stabbing each other, and he swore the famous 'shichishohokoku' (which means even he is reborn seven times, he will destroy enemies of the Emperor and serve the country), but this has been mistaken as the words that Masashige said by some.

sen.j: また、腹を切って割腹自殺したという話もある。
sen.e: Moreover, there is a story that he committed suicide by kappuku (the fixed form of suicide committed by former samurai class) by himself, too.
